sentences.en: a new initiative aimed at beating the menace of illegal drugs
sentences.cn: 旨在打击非法毒品威胁的新举措

sentences.en: A statesman must display initiative.
sentences.cn: 政治家必须有开创精神.

sentences.en: a United Nations peace initiative
sentences.cn: 联合国的和平倡议

sentences.en: anti-hunting groups have seized the initiative in the dispute.
sentences.cn: 反狩猎组织在争论中采取了主动。

sentences.en: Don’t keep asking me for advice. Use your initiative.
sentences.cn: 别老是要我给你出主意，发挥一下你自己的决断能力吧。

sentences.en: Foreign bankers and economists cautiously welcomed the minister's initiative.
sentences.cn: 外国银行家和经济学家对部长的倡议反应谨慎.

sentences.en: He displays great initiative in his work.
sentences.cn: 他工作很主动.

sentences.en: He showed little initiative, handling all matters strictly by the book.
sentences.cn: 他缺乏首创精神, 墨守成规地办一切事情.

sentences.en: He went to see the headmaster on his own initiative.
sentences.cn: 他主动去看望校长.

sentences.en: His employer had described him as lacking in initiative and drive.
sentences.cn: 雇主说他缺乏进取心和干劲.

sentences.en: I wish my son would show more initiative.
sentences.cn: 我希望我的儿子能表现得再主动一些。

sentences.en: Lt. Carlos was not obeying orders. He acted on his own initiative (= he was not told what to do ).
sentences.cn: 卡洛斯中尉没有服从命令，而是自作主张。

sentences.en: Politicians need to seize the initiative from the terrorists.
sentences.cn: 政治家需要对恐怖分子主动出击。

sentences.en: She does not like to do so from her own initiative.
sentences.cn: 她不愿意主动这么做.

sentences.en: Such initiative is highly commendable.
sentences.cn: 这种积极性是很可贵的.

sentences.en: The government must not lose the initiative in the fight against terrorism.
sentences.cn: 政府在打击恐怖主义方面不能失去主动权。

sentences.en: The Prime Minister's initiative has much to commend it.
sentences.cn: 首相的新方案有不少令人赞许之处。

sentences.en: The project was set up on the initiative of a local landowner.
sentences.cn: 工程是由当地一名土地所有者发起的.

sentences.en: The proposed initiative would mandate a reduction of carbon dioxide of 40%.
sentences.cn: 倡议将强制规定把二氧化碳排放量降低40%。

sentences.en: There's talk of a new peace initiative.
sentences.cn: 传闻有可能提出新的和平倡议。

sentences.en: We have the initiative; we intend to keep it.
sentences.cn: 我们拥有主动权；我们不打算放弃它。

sentences.en: We must take the initiative in the struggle to end the war.
sentences.cn: 为尽早结束战争，我们必须抢先行动。

sentences.en: Why don’t you take the initiative and ask him out?
sentences.cn: 为什么你不主动约他出去呢？

phrases.tran_cn: 自主的：没有他人的怂勇或指导的；自己做主的
和平倡议，倡议和平；和平的开端

trans.tran_cn: 主动性，主动精神，倡议，主动权
trans.tran_en: if you have or take the initiative, you are in a position to control a situation and decide what to do next
